intro: Malcolmia parviflora var. pachystylis, commonly known as the narrowleaf malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a slightly rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes.
